1.brief: thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
to prophesy, i.e. speak (or sing) by inspiration (in prediction or simple discourse)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
Gog, the name of an Israelite, also of some nothern nation
properly, like this, i.e. by implication, (of manner) thus (or so); also (of place) here (or hither); or (of time) now
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
near, with or among; often in general, to
Gog, the name of an Israelite, also of some nothern nation
properly, an exalted one, i.e. a king or sheik; also a rising mist
the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)
Meshek, a son of Japheth, and the people descended from him
Tubal, a postdiluvian patriarch and his posterity

2.brief: to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
to ascend, intransitively (be high) or actively (mount); used in a great variety of senses, primary and secondary, literal and figurative
properly, the flank; but used only figuratively, the rear or recess
properly, hidden, i.e. dark; used only of the north as aquarter (gloomy and unknown)
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity

a bow, forshooting (hence, figuratively, strength) or the iris
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
properly, dark (as enveloped), i.e. the north; hence (by orientation), the left hand
properly, a piercer, i.e. an arrow; by implication, a wound; figuratively, (of God) thunderbolt; the shaft of aspear
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
the right hand or side (leg, eye) of a person or other object (as the stronger and more dexterous); locally, the south
to fall, in a great variety of applications (intransitive or causative, literal or figurative)

a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
to fall, in a great variety of applications (intransitive or causative, literal or figurative)
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
(only plural) wings of an army, or crowds of troops
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
properly, nearness (used only as a preposition or an adverb), near; hence, generally, with, by, at, among, etc.

the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)

Magog, a son of Japheth; also a barbarous northern region

properly, a habitable spot (as desirable); dry land, a coast, an island
properly, a place of refuge; abstract, safety, both the fact (security) and the feeling (trust); often (adverb with or without preposition) safely

an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character

abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)
